Title.2: فيروسات كورونا هي سلالة واسعة من الفيروسات التي قد تسبب المرض للحيوان والإنسان. ومن المعروف أن عدداً من فيروسات كورونا تسبب لدى البشر أمراض تنفسية تتراوح حدتها من نزلات البرد الشائعة إلى الأمراض الأشد وخامة مثل متلازمة الشرق الأوسط التنفسية (ميرس) والمتلازمة التنفسية الحادة الوخيمة (سارس). ويسبب فيروس كورونا المُكتشف مؤخراً مرض كوفيد-۱۹

What is covid19.3: Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) is an infectious disease caused by a newly discovered coronavirus.
What is covid19.4: Most people infected with the COVID-19 virus will experience mild to moderate respiratory illness and recover without requiring special treatment. Older people, and those with underlying medical problems like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer are more likely to develop serious illness.
What is covid19.5: The best way to prevent and slow down transmission is be well informed about the COVID-19 virus, the disease it causes and how it spreads. Protect yourself and others from infection by washing your hands or using an alcohol based rub frequently and not touching your face.
What is covid19.6: The COVID-19 virus spreads primarily through droplets of saliva or discharge from the nose when an infected person coughs or sneezes, so it’s important that you also practice respiratory etiquette (for example, by coughing into a flexed elbow).
What is covid19.7: At this time, there are no specific vaccines or treatments for COVID-19. However, there are many ongoing clinical trials evaluating potential treatments. COVID-media will continue to provide updated information as soon as clinical findings become available.

How it spreads.3: COVID-19 is thought to spread mainly through close contact from person-to-person. Some people without symptoms may be able to spread the virus. We are still learning about how the virus spreads and the severity of illness it causes.
How it spreads.5: The virus is thought to spread mainly from person-to-person.
How it spreads.6: Between people who are in close contact with one another (within about 6 feet).
How it spreads.7: Through respiratory droplets produced when an infected person coughs, sneezes, or talks.
How it spreads.8: These droplets can land in the mouths or noses of people who are nearby or possibly be inhaled into the lungs.
How it spreads.9: COVID-19 may be spread by people who are not showing symptoms.
How it spreads.10: The virus spreads easily between people
How it spreads.11: How easily a virus spreads from person-to-person can vary. Some viruses are highly contagious, like measles, while other viruses do not spread as easily. Another factor is whether the spread is sustained, which means it goes from person-to-person without stopping.
How it spreads.12: The virus that causes COVID-19 is spreading very easily and sustainably between people
How it spreads.13: . Information from the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic suggests that this virus is spreading more efficiently than influenza, but not as efficiently as measles, which is highly contagious. In general,
How it spreads.14: the more closely a person interacts with others and the longer that interaction, the higher the risk of COVID-19 spread
How it spreads.16: The virus may be spread in other ways
How it spreads.17: It may be possible that a person can get COVID-19 by
How it spreads.18: touching a surface or object that has the virus on it
How it spreads.19: and then touching their own mouth, nose, or possibly their eyes. This is not thought to be the main way the virus spreads, but we are still learning more about how this virus spreads.
